DESCRIPTION.value: Gigabit Ethernet Extension Board
1: CLOCK TO MAC output is 125 MHz, 0: CLOCK TO MAC output is 25 MHz
1: PHY is manually set to cross-over mode (MDIX), 0: PHY is manually set to straight mode (MDI)
1: CLK_TO_MAC clock output enabled, 0: CLK_TO_MAC disabled
1: Enables pair swap mode, 0: Disables the Auto-MDIX and defaults the part into the mode preset by the MAN_MDIX_STRAP pin
1: Selects multiple node priority (switch or hub), 0: Selects single node priority (NIC)

MAC Interface selector

 RGMII_SEL1 | RGMII_SEL0 | MAC Interface
----------------------------------------
 0 | 0 | GMII
 0 | 1 | GMII
 1 | 0 | RGMII - HP
 1 | 1 | RGMII - 3COM

MAC Interface selector

 RGMII_SEL1 | RGMII_SEL0 | MAC Interface
----------------------------------------
 0 | 0 | GMII
 0 | 1 | GMII
 1 | 0 | RGMII - HP
 1 | 1 | RGMII - 3COM

PHY Address selector

PHY ADDRESS [4:1]: The DP83865 provides five PHY address-
 sensing pins for multiple PHY applications.
 The setting on these five pins provides the base
 address of the PHY. The five PHYAD[4:0] bits are
 registered as inputs at reset with PHYADDR4 being
 the MSB of the 5-bit PHY address. BIT 0 is fixed
 to logic 1

PHY Address selector

PHY ADDRESS [4:1]: The DP83865 provides five PHY address-
 sensing pins for multiple PHY applications.
 The setting on these five pins provides the base
 address of the PHY. The five PHYAD[4:0] bits are

 to logic 1

 sensing pins for multiple PHY applications.

PHY Address selector

PHY ADDRESS [4:1]: The DP83865 provides five PHY address-
 sensing pins for multiple PHY applications.
 The setting on these five pins provides the base

Speed selector

Auto-Neg disabled:

 Speed[1] | Speed[0] | Speed enabled
-------------------------------------
 1 | 1 | Reserved
 1 | 0 | 1000BASE-T
 0 | 1 | 100BASE-TX
 0 | 0 | 10BASE-T

Auto-Neg enabled:

 Speed[1] | Speed[0] | Speed enabled
-------------------------------------
 1 | 1 | 1000BASE-T, 10BASE-T
 1 | 0 | 1000BASE-T
 0 | 1 | 1000BASE-T, 100BASE-TX
 0 | 0 | 1000BASE-T, 100BASE-TX, 10BASE-T

Speed selector

Auto-Neg disabled:

 Speed[1] | Speed[0] | Speed enabled
-------------------------------------
 1 | 1 | Reserved
 1 | 0 | 1000BASE-T
 0 | 1 | 100BASE-TX
 0 | 0 | 10BASE-T

Auto-Neg enabled:

 Speed[1] | Speed[0] | Speed enabled
-------------------------------------
 1 | 1 | 1000BASE-T, 10BASE-T
 1 | 0 | 1000BASE-T
 0 | 1 | 1000BASE-T, 100BASE-TX
 0 | 0 | 1000BASE-T, 100BASE-TX, 10BASE-T
1: Enables Auto-Neg., 0: Disables Auto-Neg
1: Enables Full Duplex by default, 0: Enables Half Duplex only
1: CLOCK TO MAC output is 125 MHz, 0: CLOCK TO MAC output is 25 MHz
1: PHY is manually set to cross-over mode (MDIX), 0: PHY is manually set to straight mode (MDI)
1: CLK_TO_MAC clock output enabled, 0: CLK_TO_MAC disabled
1: Enables pair swap mode, 0: Disables the Auto-MDIX and defaults the part into the mode preset by the MAN_MDIX_STRAP pin
1: Selects multiple node priority (switch or hub), 0: Selects single node priority (NIC)

MAC Interface selector

 RGMII_SEL1 | RGMII_SEL0 | MAC Interface
----------------------------------------
 0 | 0 | GMII
 0 | 1 | GMII
 1 | 0 | RGMII - HP
 1 | 1 | RGMII - 3COM

MAC Interface selector

 RGMII_SEL1 | RGMII_SEL0 | MAC Interface
